unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Find $H_{a}$
question_text: Which of the following is an alternative hypothesis for a chi-square test of independence?

choices.text: H a H a :  There is no association between two categorical variables in a given population
H a H a :  There is a difference in distributions of a categorical variable across populations.
H a H a :  Two categorical variables in a population are associated.
H a H a :  At least one of the given proportions is not equal to what is specified in the null hypothesis.
H a H a :  There is no difference in distributions of a categorical variable across populations.
